title: Bastian Schweinsteiger officially joins MLS side Chicago Fire after leaving Manchester United
text:
Sport Bastian Schweinsteiger officially joins MLS side Chicago Fire after leaving Manchester United The German World Cup winner agreed to join Fire earlier this month after a disappointing spell at Old Trafford Share By Jim Daly Mick Gadd 18:17, 29 MAR 2017 Bastian Schweinsteiger with the Chicago Fire team doctor (Photo: Twitter/BSchweinsteiger) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Bastian Schweinsteiger has completed his move from Manchester United to Chicago Fire after a nightmare 18 months at Old Trafford. 
The World Cup winner was an outcast under Jose Mourinho and his move away from the Red Devils has been on the cards for some time. 
On Wednesday he completed his move to the MLS side after waiting for paperwork to be completed. 
A statement on United's website read: "Everybody at United would like to wish Basti the very best of luck in the next chapter of his career." The 32-year-old was mobbed by fans on his arrival in Chicago as he prepares for the next stage of his career. 
The former Manchester United midfielder and wife Ana Ivanovic flew to the US on Tuesday. 
Schweinsteiger was given a hero's welcome as he touched down at O'Hare International Airport and took time out to pose for pictures and sign autographs for supporters who turned out to greet him. Schweinstiger signs autographs outside O'Hare International Airport (Photo: AFP) The midfielder poses for photos (Photo: AFP) 
The German World Cup winner showed class throughout his time an outcast at United and handled his departure with the same quality. 
He appeared to be beaming to be off to Major League Soccer for the next chapter of his illustrious career. 
Schweinsteiger and now-retired former world No1 tennis ace Ivanovic sported grins and held up their respective passports as they settled in for their flight. 
"On my way to Chicago with @anaivanovic!" he posted on Instagram before take-off. "On my way to Chicago with @anaivanovic!" Schweinsteiger announces his departure from England (Photo: bastianschweinsteiger/Instagram) 
The 32-year-old ended a torrid 18 months at Man United that would struggle to earn any entries on a highlights real of the former Bayern Munich star's career. 
Fitness and then Jose Mourinho condemned him to the sidelines before the MLS came knocking and the Red Devils let him walk out the door. 
Schweinsteiger has kept his fitness up in Spain this week as he waited for a US work visa to come through, basing himself at RCD Mallorca. 
His Fire contract is for at least £3.5m a year, down from his £130,000-a-week deal in Manchester but that doesn't seem to bother him one bit. 
He has struggled for opportunities this term under Jose Mourinho and will hope to resurrect his career stateside. 
Last week he took to Instagram to pay tribute to a number of influential figures, in particular skipper Rooney and fitness coach Paolo Gaudino. 
Meanwhile, Germany boss Joachim Low suggested the midfielder still had plenty to offer United.
